alert.note: Alert for Pike (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 16 at 7:09PM CST until February 16 at 8:00PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of southern Mississippi, including the following counties, Amite, Pike and Walthall. * WHEN...Until 815 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways and overflowing poor drainage areas may be occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 700 PM CST, Earlier rainfall of 2 to 3 inches may be causing urban and small stream flooding. - The heaviest rainfall has moved out of the area, but light/scattered rainfall remains. If any flooding has resulted, it will take time for the water to drain away. Please use caution driving in the dark because it is difficult to see flooded roadways. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Mccomb, Magnolia, Osyka, Salem, Gillsburg and Mccomb Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
